Contact Mainstreet RENTAL INQUIRIES: Please call or email us directly from any property web page. Alternatively, you may contact the applicable Regional Office or fill out the form on this page. Please allow up to 24 hours for a response. RESIDENT INQUIRIES: If you are currently a resident at a Mainstreet property, please contact your building Resident Manager or your Regional Office. In case of an after-hours emergency relating to a suite or building, please call 1-866-480-6246 . If the emergency is an immediate threat to someone's safety or security, including crimes in progress, please call 911 . OFFICE HOURS: All Mainstreet regional offices and head office are open Monday - Friday, 8:00 am - 5:00 pm local time . All our offices are closed on weekends ( Saturday & Sunday ) and for observance of all statutory holidays. OTHER INQUIRIES: For information about the Belize Consulate in Alberta , please visit belizeconsulatealberta.com . Overview Join Us Renew Your Membership Donate Partner With Us Job Opportunities English Español Member Login Donate Search We are main street america Marion, Iowa © Tasha Sams Main Street America leads a collaborative movement with partners and grassroots leaders that advances shared prosperity, creates resilient economies, and improves quality of life through place-based economic development and community preservation in downtowns and neighborhood commercial districts across the country. A Proven Track Record For more than 40 years, Main Street America has helped to build economic power in downtowns and neighborhood commercial districts through our signature Main Street Approach™ framework. Founded as the National Main Street Center® in 1980 , Main Street America has helped to generate over $ 115 . 27 billion in local reinvestment, rehab 345 , 801 buildings, create 815 , 894 new jobs, and start 181 , 647 new businesses in over 2 , 000 communities. Play Video: Main Street America Main Street America Main Street America We Believe Main Streets Are for everyone Everyone should have access to an inclusive and resilient Main Street — a place that has a thriving local economy, is distinctive and rich in character, and features welcoming spaces and diverse businesses for residents and visitors alike. Main Street America models and champions this vision through our actions and programs. Learn more about our vision and steps we are taking to shape an inclusive future. Who We Are Main Street America has been helping strengthen and reenergize downtowns and neighborhood ﻿commercial districts for more than 40 years. About Us – Mainstreet Leadership September 10, 2025 Home About Us Services Contact Us Home About Us Services Contact Us We Can Help Your Main Street Business Build, Revive, Evolve Good leadership makes for great culture! about main street leadership Main Street Leadership is here to help traditional businesses grow, renew, reinvigorate – to just plain be successful. We’re here to help, both now, and when your business needs to innovate, remake itself, change owners, or process generational transitions in family leadership. We’re here to help you. We define traditional businesses as mainstay businesses: dry cleaners, auto parts supply stores, gas stations, HVAC companies, plumbers, and electricians. Even some manufacturing facilities fall into the traditional business category. You know these companies. They live where you live. It’s the plumber two streets over who hung out his shingle in 1978; the dry cleaner down the block that now has second generation ownership; the manufacturer near the highway exit that has had a steady work force of fifty-five employees for three decades. Traditional businesses have stood the test of time, been bastions of the community, and are—in most cases—doing business in the same way they always have. You see, for most traditional businesses, each year is pretty much a repeat of the previous year. With so much sameness, you can see how it’s easy to get lulled into a comforting routine. jamie gerdsen Jamie Gerdsen has become the spokesman for that mainstay of the U.S. economy–the traditional business. As CEO of Apollo Home, Jamie completely changed the culture of his company, resulting in growth in customers served, and employees hired. A noted speaker, Jamie is active in leadership positions within the Young Presidents’ Organization, is in demand on service boards, and has been part of Forty Under 40, and Leadership Cincinnati. books The thing about zombies is you don’t know them when you see them. They’re invisible; but don’t be fooled. As they walk unnoticed through the halls of your small business, they’re doing a number—a negative number—on your bottom line. They slow productivity, treat your customers rudely, and infect other employees with their poor morale and shoddy work ethic. In a small business, one zombie—one employee not pulling his or her share of the workload—can make all the difference. So dive in and learn more on how to handle them Leading change is hard. Leading change in a traditional industry can seem impossible. Jamie Gerdsen presents hard-learned lessons for inspiring innovation in traditional industries, such as manufacturing or his own heating, cooling, and plumbing company. Through personal stories of trial and error and eventual triumph over the roadblocks to change, you’ll discover how to embrace and foster innovation in your own organization. Discussions include hiring, employee motivation, professional focus, coaching, the business cycle, and work-life balance. staff Peter Winick Chief Operating Officer Peter Winick makes everything at Main Street Leadership work. He is a maestro of results driven by practical strategy and focused execution. He expertly leverages over twenty years’ experience with such clients as IBM, Kraft, Microsoft, Avon, Hyatt and more. Peter works tirelessly to understand our clients’ precise needs, then creates a blended solution that fits like a glove. Having built and managed several consulting and professional development organizations, Peter uses his seasoned perspective to deliver perfectly selected solutions in a perfectly selected format, to our clients every time. He believes that taking great services and creating a platform to best support it takes a combination of art, science, logic, focus, passion and creativity. Skills he combines and leverages for our clients. Bill Sherman VP, Product Development Bill Sherman leads Main Street Leadership’s consulting, training and organizational change practice areas. He helps organizations understand their current leadership practices, then produces lasting impact through strategically-targeted interventions. Bill has guided many of the world’s most recognizable brands through complex organizational change. Over the past fifteen years, Bill has bridged the critical gap between the business thinkers who create insights and the senior business leaders who need to produce results. His past challenges for global brands have included strategic reengineering of people and processes, organizational culture and performance management and system realignment. In order to achieve results for our clients, Bill leads a highly-skilled team of designers, developers, organizational consultants, and operations specialists. Together, they shepherd ideas from the abstract world of ideas into scalable business solutions that produce measurable results. Lonnie Harmon Operations Director Lonnie Harmon, as Main Street Leadership’s Operations Director, has a depth and breadth of experience in training and organizational change at organizations of all sizes and cultures. Following a notable career at a Fortune 100 company, he went on to oversee the growth of a niche ERP training company. He then founded his own company providing innovative training to companies as diverse as DHL, Merck, Wells Fargo, and Harley-Davidson. At Main Street, Lonnie uses his project management skills to keep our client projects running on or ahead of schedule. Regardless of your industry, your culture, or your challenges, Lonnie has seen it and provided both tactical and strategic improvements. Whatever you’re goals for an engagement are, Lonnie will be behind the scenes writing, conducting outreach, planning schedules and just generally keeping your project on track. Reinvigorate Your Business! Contact Us Social Media email info@mainstreetlead.com Hello! I consent to Main Street Leadership collecting my details through this form. Send

My Mainstreet — P3 Parker 0 Skip to Content P3 in Action My Mainstreet Capital Improvement Projects Public Art Business Resources Façade and Landscape Improvement Program (FLIP) Tax Increment Financing (TIF) Urban Renewal Areas Cottonwood Parker Road Parker Central Interactive URA Map About P3 How We Operate Let's Talk P3 Video Series Who We Are News Economic Development Connect Contact Records Request 303.805.3136 Search Open Menu Close Menu P3 in Action My Mainstreet Capital Improvement Projects Public Art Business Resources Façade and Landscape Improvement Program (FLIP) Tax Increment Financing (TIF) Urban Renewal Areas Cottonwood Parker Road Parker Central Interactive URA Map About P3 How We Operate Let's Talk P3 Video Series Who We Are News Economic Development Connect Contact Records Request 303.805.3136 Search Open Menu Close Menu Folder: P3 in Action Back My Mainstreet Capital Improvement Projects Public Art Folder: Business Resources Back Façade and Landscape Improvement Program (FLIP) Tax Increment Financing (TIF) Folder: Urban Renewal Areas Back Cottonwood Parker Road Parker Central Interactive URA Map Folder: About P3 Back How We Operate Let's Talk P3 Video Series Who We Are News Economic Development Folder: Connect Back Contact Records Request 303.805.3136 Search MY MAINSTREET The My Mainstreet project was a community effort to encourage the right growth in the right places in Downtown Parker. The project's goal was to partner with Town residents, business owners, and developers to define what the community wanted to see on five different sites in Downtown Parker and what was feasible for the private market to develop. Updates In 2022, the Parker Town Council and P3 Board of Directors approved a development agreement with Confluence Companies to develop six publicly owned parcels. In February 2025, Confluence gave a presentation to the Parker Town Council showing updated site plans and renderings. See the presentation (PDF) Watch the meeting video Find information about leasing or buying space in a developed My Mainstreet property What is going to be built on the My Mainstreet properties? As of February 2025, the following is planned for the My Mainstreet properties: EastMain 309 Apartments 18,275 sq. ft. Commercial Retail Parking Structure with 368 parking spots Pine Curve 23 Townhome units 154 Apartment units 2,000 sq. ft. Residential Common Building 13,500 sq. ft. Commercial Retail 18,000 sq. ft. Commercial Market Surface and Structured Parking: 487 spaces Pace Lot 124 For-Sale Condominimus 49,200 sq. ft. Commercial Office/Retail/Restaurant Surface Parking: 325 spaces Schoolhouse 9,300 sq. ft. Commercial Office/Retail/Restaurant Surface Parking: 19 spaces Par Property: 23,830 sq. ft. Commercial Office/Retail/Restaurant Surface Parking: 63 spaces What's the history of the My Mainstreet project? Over the course of 2018, P3 engaged Parker residents online through different surveys on Let’s Talk Parker and by setting up at different events to engage the public in person and share the findings through electronic newsletters and social media. These interactions helped shape the future of the downtown vision and guided future investments in the space. At the end of the project, P3 was armed with a set of guidelines for developing four different sites in Downtown Parker. Read the My Mainstreet Strategic Framework* See the documents, including the survey results, associated with the My Mainstreet Project* Please contact P3 for a printed version of any documents. What type of feedback was gathered for the My Mainstreet Project? During the My Mainstreet, the P3 team engaged Parker residents, Council Members, and staff in various ways. This included: 7 Council Members 1,217 Parker Residents 15 Downtown Business Alliance Leaders 5 Planning Commission Members Where can I find the My Mainstreet Masterplan? In April 2024, Confluence Companies presented initial concepts for the six lots along mainstreet including land use, estimated cost, and estimated timeline. The presentation also included inspirational renderings of building concepts and proposed programs. View the Presentation from Confluence *Please contact P3 for a printed version of the presentation. How can I lease or buy space in a My Mainstreet Property? Confluence has developed a website for those looking to lease or buy space in a My Mainstreet property at MyMainstreetParker.com What's happening at East Mainstreet? The site plans for the East Mainstreet Project and the Parking Garage at the PACE Center were submitted in 2023. The proposed East Main lot plan includes a five-story mixed-use building with restaurants, retail, housing, and underground parking. P3 is partnering with the Town of Parker to develop a parking garage next to the PACE Center. Where can I learn more about the history of the project? Visit the Town's Let's Talk Parker website to learn more about the history of the project. Explore This Section Who We Are How We Work Partner Collaborations Our Supporters Our Team Contact Us Who We Are How We Work Partner Collaborations Our Supporters Our Team Contact Us Atlanta, Georgia © Main Street America WE ARE MAIN STREET Main Street America ( MSA ) leads an inclusive, impact-driven movement dedicated to reenergizing and strengthening older and historic downtowns and neighborhood commercial districts through place-based economic development and community preservation. We work in collaboration with thousands of local partners and grassroots leaders across the nation who share our commitment to advancing shared prosperity, creating resilient economies, and improving quality of life. Main Street America was founded in 1980 as the National Main Street Center®, a program of the National Trust for Historic Preservation. Over the past 40 years the MSA network has helped to generate over $ 115 . 27 billion in local reinvestment, rehab 345 , 801 buildings, create 815 , 894 new jobs, and start 181 , 647 new businesses in over 2 , 000 communities. Our History Main Street America has been helping reenergize and strengthen communities since 1977 . Mary Means, the founder of Main Street (left) © The National Trust for Historic Preservation Link to Our History Our Strategic Plan Main Street America’s new Strategic Plan will guide our work for the next 5 – 10 years, building on our legacy and core purpose. Link to Our Strategic Plan Our Team Our team is comprised of highly talented and passionate individuals dedicated to place-based economic development. Atlanta, Georgia © Main Street America Link to Our Team Job Opportunities Explore opportunities to join our team of highly skilled and dedicated individuals committed to place-based economic development. Main Street America team at the 2022 Main Street Now Conference in Richmond, Virginia. © Main Street America Link to Job Opportunities We Believe Main Streets Are for Everyone Everyone should have access to an inclusive and resilient Main Street – a place that has a thriving local economy, is distinctive and rich in character, and features welcoming spaces and diverse businesses for residents and visitors alike. Main Street America models and champions this vision through our actions and programs. Learn more about our vision and steps we are taking to shape an inclusive future . Main Spotlight: The Economics of Fall Foliage Tourism Fall foliage tourism has a substantial economic impact on small towns and rural areas nationwide. Learn how Main Streets can leverage their leaves to boost their communities this fall. September 9, 2025 Vibrant fall colors drive tourists to towns like Stowe, Vermont. Photo by BackyardProduction. Insights Staff Spotlight: Exploring Arkansas with Lisa Mullins Thompson Lisa shares reflections about eight Arkansas communities that recently received assessment visits August 28, 2025 Lisa Mullins Thompson traveled across the state with Main Street Arkansas. Photo by Lisa Mullins Thompson. Storytelling Main Spotlight: 5 Tips for Running a Successful Grant Program Our grantmaking team shares their advice to help you run a successful grant program and expand your impact in your community. August 26, 2025 Mercado del Pueblo Business Incubator received a grant from The Hartford Small Business Accelerator Grant Program. Photo courtesy of PRCC . How-to Just Dropped: New Courses in the Main Street America Academy Deepen your knowledge, bring your vision to life, and expand your impact with our latest Main Street America Academy course. Whether you’re navigating your first grant or hosting a community event, the Local Main Street Leader Launching module is designed to support your growth without burning out. August 20, 2025 Turn plans into progress with the Local Main Street Leader Launching courses. Photo by KandE Productions. Announcement Vintage Vibes, Digital Drive with Rachael Kehler, Peppermint Stick Candy Store Join host Matt Wagner for his conversation with Rachael Kehler, owner of The Peppermint Stick Candy Store in Boyertown, Pennsylvania. In this episode, Matt and Rachael discuss her journey to entrepreneurship, leveraging nostalgia as a marketing tool, small town tourism, and more. August 20, 2025 Storytelling Main Spotlight: Building Shared Priorities to Unlock Growth Main Street America has partnered with the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation to explore the impact of the Capital Absorption Framework in Main Street communities in Virginia and Wisconsin. August 19, 2025 Participants in Wisconsin gather for a workshop in West Allis, WI . Photo by Main Street America. Insights Community Spotlight: How Nashville’s Entrepreneurs are Driving Community Transformation Discover how small businesses are breaking barriers in our Breaking Barriers to Business (B3) series, starting with a powerful spotlight on Nashville’s local changemakers. August 14, 2025 Nashville, Tennessee © Breaking Barriers to Business ( B 3 ) Storytelling Made on Main: DANE Fragrance As part of a new series on Main Street America’s online store, Shop Main Street, we're highlighting the stories behind the amazing brands, makers, and producers along our Main Streets. Today, we’re highlighting DANE Fragrance, a perfumery based in Ukiah, California. August 14, 2025 Storytelling Spotlight on a Main Street Board Member: The Visionary Spirit of Maxine Clark Meet Maxine Clark—entrepreneur, philanthropist, and board member at Delmar Main Street in St. Louis, Missouri—and hear Erin's takeaways from their conversation about advocacy, resiliency, and leadership. August 7, 2025 From left: Gayla Roten, State Director at Missouri Main Street; Felice McClendon, Executive Director at Delmar Main Street; Maxine Clark, Delmar Main Street Board Member and Chief Inspirator at Delmar DivINe; Erin Barnes, President and CEO at Main Street America. Photo courtesy of Maxine Clark. Storytelling Main Spotlight: How a Fresh Start Revitalized Downtown Maryville’s Market Scene Farmers markets are fantastic tools to support local businesses, drive traffic downtown, and build community connections. Learn how Downtown Maryville built their market from an idea to a success. August 5, 2025 The Downtown Maryville Market brings people of all ages to Maryville’s Main Street. Photo courtesy of Downtown Maryville. How-to Main Spotlight: Walking Together to Connect a Community Charles Town Now brings people together with an event that celebrates the importance of nothing. Discover how they organized the event and its lasting impact on the community. July 29, 2025 The Charles Town community gathered for their largest Walk About Nothing on June 4 th . Photo courtesy of Charles Town Now. Storytelling Strengthen Local Economies with the 2025 Supporting Small Businesses on Main Street Course Generously sponsored by U.S. Bank, this live, three-week course centers the real challenges of entrepreneurs and equips Main Street leaders with invaluable insights and practical tools to respond. Register today! July 28, 2025 Oregon City, Oregon. Photo by Adam Wickham. Executive Committee :: Main Street Capital Corporation (MAIN) Skip to main content Skip to section navigation Skip to footer News Contact Careers Home About About Lower Middle Market Solutions Private Credit Solutions Company History Corporate Social Responsibility Team Executive Committee Lower Middle Market Team Private Credit Team Finance, Legal, Compliance, & Accounting Board of Directors Portfolio Companies Lower Middle Market Private Credit Investors IR Overview News & Events Company Information Financial Information Listed Securities Information SEC Filings Governance For Business Owners What Makes Us Different Who We Invest In Why Businesses Partner With Us How We Invest Minority Recapitalization News Contact Careers Search Search Main Street Executive Committee Committed to creating value and building long-term relationships Team Team Executive Committee Lower Middle Market Team Private Credit Team Finance, Legal, Compliance, & Accounting Board of Directors View Bio Dwayne Hyzak Member of the Board and Chief Executive Officer Dwayne Hyzak Member of the Board and Chief Executive Officer Phone: 713-350-6013 Email: dhyzak@mainstcapital.com Location: Houston, Texas Mr. Hyzak has served as Main Street’s Chief Executive Officer since November 2018 and as a member of our Board since January 2018. Mr. Hyzak also serves as a member of our management team’s executive and investment committees. Mr. Hyzak previously served in several executive roles from 2011 to 2018, including as our President (2015 until November 2018), Chief Operating Officer (2014 until November 2018), Chief Financial Officer (2011 until 2014) and Senior Managing Director since 2011 and also served in other senior executive positions at Main Street prior to 2011. Prior to our IPO in 2007, Mr. Hyzak served as a Senior Managing Director and other executive positions of several Main Street predecessor funds and entities, which are now our subsidiaries. Mr. Hyzak joined Main Street in 2002, becoming one of the founding members of the firm. Since October 2020, Mr. Hyzak has also served as the Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board of MSC Income. Prior to joining Main Street, Mr. Hyzak was a Director of Integration with Quanta Services, Inc. (NYSE: PWR), which provides specialty contracting services to the power, natural gas and telecommunications industries, where he was principally focused on the company’s mergers and acquisitions and corporate finance activities. Previously, Mr. Hyzak was a Manager with Arthur Andersen in its Transaction Advisory Services group. Mr. Hyzak currently serves on the board of directors of Child Advocates, a non-profit organization that trains and supports advocates to serve the interests of abused or neglected children in the greater Houston area. View Bio David Magdol President and Chief Investment Officer David Magdol President and Chief Investment Officer Phone: 713-350-6009 Email: dmagdol@mainstcapital.com Location: Houston, Texas David Magdol is our President and Chief Investment Officer. Mr. Magdol also serves as a member of our management team’s executive and investment committees. He was promoted to the role of President in November 2018 and has served as Chief Investment Officer since 2011. Previously, he also served as Vice Chairman and Senior Managing Director and in other senior executive positions at Main Street. Prior to our IPO in 2007, Mr. Magdol served as a Senior Managing Director and other executive positions of several Main Street predecessor funds and entities, which are now our subsidiaries. Mr. Magdol joined Main Street in 2002, becoming one of the founding members of the firm. Since October 2020, Mr. Magdol has also served as the President and Chief Investment Officer of MSC Income. Prior to joining Main Street, Mr. Magdol was a Vice President in the investment banking group at Lazard Freres & Co. Previously, he managed a portfolio of private equity investments for the McMullen Group, a private investment firm/family office capitalized by Dr. John J. McMullen, the former owner of the New Jersey Devils and the Houston Astros. Mr. Magdol began his career in the structured finance services group of JP Morgan Chase. View Bio Jesse Morris Executive Vice President, Chief Operating Officer and Senior Managing Director Jesse Morris Executive Vice President, Chief Operating Officer and Senior Managing Director Phone: 713-350-9221 Email: jmorris@mainstcapital.com Location: Houston, Texas Jesse Morris is our Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer. Mr. Morris also serves as a member of our management team’s executive committee. He has management responsibility over the firm’s internal operations and is also a Senior Managing Director on our lower middle market investment team where his responsibilities include managing a portfolio of lower middle market investments where he is an active board member and assists those companies with various strategic initiatives, capital raises and M&A activity. Mr. Morris is also responsible for originating and executing new investments for the firm. Mr. Morris has served as our Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer since joining Main Street in 2019 and previously served as Main Street’s Chief Financial Officer from 2021 until August 2024. Mr. Morris has also served as the Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer of MSC Income since October 2020 and previously served as MSC Income’s Chief Financial Officer from 2021 until July 2024. Prior to joining Main Street, Mr. Morris served in various roles of increasing responsibility with Quanta Services, Inc. (NYSE: PWR) from 2014 to 2019 including most recently as Executive Vice President – Finance and President – Infrastructure Solutions. In this position, he oversaw the accounting, treasury, tax and financial planning and analysis activities and led Quanta’s public-private partnership (P3) concession and private infrastructure investment activities. Prior to joining Quanta, Mr. Morris served in various financial and accounting positions of increasing responsibility with Sysco Corporation (NYSE: SYY) including as Vice President and Chief Financial Officer – Foodservice Operations and Vice President of Finance and Chief Financial Officer – Broadline Operations. Mr. Morris began his career as a certified public accountant and was an Experienced Manager with Arthur Andersen. View Bio Jason Beauvais Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary Jason Beauvais Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary Phone: 713-350-6043 Email: jbeauvais@mainstcapital.com Location: Houston, Texas Jason Beauvais is our Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary. Mr. Beauvais also serves as a member of our management team’s executive committee. He has management responsibility over the firm’s legal, compliance, human resources and technology functions. Mr. Beauvais has served as General Counsel and Secretary since joining the firm in 2008, as Chief Compliance Officer since 2012 and as Executive Vice President since 2021. Since October 2020, Mr. Beauvais has also served as General Counsel and Secretary of MSC Income and as Executive Vice President since 2021. In addition, he is a member of the Board of Directors of the Houston Arboretum & Nature Center, a non-profit urban nature sanctuary. Prior to joining Main Street, Mr. Beauvais was an attorney with Occidental Petroleum Corporation (NYSE: OXY), an international oil and gas exploration and production company. Before that, Mr. Beauvais practiced corporate and securities law at Baker Botts L.L.P., where he primarily counseled companies in public issuances and private placements of debt and equity and handled a wide range of general corporate and securities matters as well as mergers and acquisitions. All Rights Reserved. 860-647-1551 CT Web Design   | ImageWorks, LLC. FAQs Where do I park when coming to The Main Pub? The Main Pub has a brand new parking lot with over 55 spots right behind our building. Parking on Main Street is also a very popular option. Parking can also take place on West Middle Turnpike when the white lines become wide enough to fit a car DO NOT park at Walgreens across the street as they will tow How old do I have to be to enter The Main Pub bar for sports or live entertainment? You must be 21 years old or be accompanied by your parent or legal guardian Does The Main Pub doing catering or private parties? Yes we do. Please click the Private Dining page on the Navigation Menu for more info. How does my band get a gig at The Main Pub? Please submit a press kit to booking@mainpub.com I would really like to work at The Main Pub, how do I apply? All interested applicants should come into the restaurant with a resume and fill out an application. A manager will set up interviews with qualified candidates when positions come open Does The Main Pub serve gluten free items? We have a few items on our menu that are gluten free but our Chef will gladly make adaptions to current menu items to assure your health and safety. Does The Main Pub take reservations? Yes you can call the restaurant at 860-647-1551 Is The Main Pub kid friendly? Very much so. We are a family restaurant and we feature a special kids menu. About Us - Mainstreet London About Us Our Programs Destination Downtown Pop Up Shops Windows Contact Us @mainstreetldn twitter account MainStreetldn Facebook account Instagram About Us Vision Our Downtown is London’s first neighbourhood, a vibrant mix of history, commerce, residents, visitors, and unique experiences. MainStreet London (MSL) is a non-profit downtown revitalization organization. Our goal is to help you transform your great idea into a great business in Downtown London. Whether it is through our programs, or working with partners like London Economic Development Corporation, London Small Business Centre, the City of London, and many others, we have the resources, knowledge, and supports to ensure that your business can thrive in Downtown London. If you are a downtown property owner interested in improving your building and/or attracting new tenants, or helping your existing tenant to grow their businesses, we are here to help you too! Contact us to learn more about the entrepreneurial ecosystem we are developing to support businesses and property owners . Key Stats and Facts Over the last five years, the population of London, Ont., grew at the fastest rate in Ontario and the fourth fastest in the country, Statistics Canada reported, a remarkable uptick fuelled primarily by increased international migration and intra-provincial migration. Currently there are over 58,000 (33,700 households and growing) people living, or within a 15 minute walk of the downtown core area. There are another 2,100 units under construction in the downtown core that will be completed by the end of 2023 with an additional 1,200+ new units that are proposed to start by 2024, with many more units planned and additional announcements to come. London is one of the fastest growing communities in Canada. It brings the city’s population to 422,324 in 2021, up 10 per cent from 383,822 when the last census was conducted in 2016, with notable population growth of 12 per cent specifically in the city’s downtown. ( CBC News , February 2022 ) Downtown Residents Downtown residents are segmented into three broad categories: young professionals, empty nesters, and young families. Median household income: $71,873. 48% are 20-39 years old. What attracts this group: unique events and experiences such as our amazing festivals, street parties on Dundas Place; great places to eat and relax; the vibrant nightlife; and the easy access to green spaces and bike trails. Downtown London is surrounded by amenities that are enjoyed by everyone in London and especially those that live in the core. Downtown Workers Largest sectors: Municipal, Finance, Insurance, Technology, Education, and Real Estate. What attracts this group: both traditional and creative office spaces; plenty of after work options for dining and entertainment; grab-and-go meals; easy access to parks and greenspace; and wonderful patios and places to eat outside. Downtown Students Fanshawe College: 2,500+ students; 300+ faculty. London International Academy: 350 International secondary students. Western University: opening a new satellite campus downtown with 13 different programs, scheduled to open in fall 2023. What attracts this group: original places to eat; vibrant nightlife; social hubs and study spaces. Downtown Visitors Downtown London attracted 2.7 million visitors pre-Covid. Now that we are seeing an increase in conventions, public events, festivals, concerts, and sporting events return in a big way, visitors love our unique and authentic restaurants, shopping, and extraordinary entertainment found only in the Downtown core. What attracts this group: a vibrant nightlife, unique events and experiences; amazing restaurants; destination stores and one-of-a-kind retail. Downtown London is diverse, growing, and welcoming. This is the location for your business. Contact us and let’s talk about your business idea and how we can help you establish your business in the Downtown . Work with us MainStreet London is focused on a single mission – to grow a diverse mix of new and existing businesses in London’s downtown. Whether you need a few contacts or full-service mentorship, we’re here for you. Starting or expanding a business is complex. We can help simplify it, with everything from big picture support to the fine details. Our services include: Facilitating access to grants and loans to improve and beautify your new space Referrals to supports and resources for business owners System navigation and roadblock removal Professional Development and learning Peer-to-peer networking Connect you with a local entrepreneurial ecosystem and community of entrepreneurs When you choose a downtown location you become a member of the Downtown London BIA and its vibrant business community. For more information about the advantages to being a downtown business owner, click here to visit downtownlondon.ca We are a catalyst, connector, and collaborative partner, working with a broad network of organizations and community stakeholders to encourage main street commerce. Our programs and services foster economic development activities that will promote investment and support projects that reflect our vision for our local neighbourhoods. ® MainStreet London | Privacy Policy | contact@mainstreetlondon.ca | Website by Renaissance Monkey Design
